headline: Turkish Inflation Seen Marching Higher on Summer Loan Frenzy
summary: Turkey’s summertime credit binge and weak lira are still pushing prices higher, fueling expectations that the central bank will be forced to keep access to credit tight after a surprise interest-rate increase.
Investors brace for another volatile week with President Donald Trump's hospitalization adding more uncertainty to the market outlook ahead of Election Day.
headline: Dow futures rise 150 points in overnight trading as investors monitor Trump's health

summary: Federated Hermes’ Phil Orlando signals his bull case may be on borrowed time.
headline: Market bull reveals two risks keeping him up at night and why they may alter his forecast
How to change the default email app on your iPhone so you can use Gmail or Outlook instead
summary: Choose your favorite email app, and when you click an email address link, iOS 14 will launch that app instead of Apple's.

headline: Trump experienced drops in oxygen levels Friday and Saturday but his condition has improved, doctor says

summary: TipRanks analyst ranking service pinpoints Wall Street's best-performing stocks, like Amazon and CarMax.
headline: Wall Street's top analysts are unanimously bullish on stocks like Amazon and CarMax
Coronavirus hospitalizations grow in the Midwest amid climbing cases — 'It's clearly a forest fire'
summary: Six states reached record high Covid-19 hospitalizations as of Friday, based on a weekly average, including Missouri, Wisconsin, North Dakota and South Dakota.
The Apple-Google system for sending Covid-19 alerts is gaining momentum in the United States, six months after it was first announced.
headline: States are finally starting to use the Covid-tracking tech Apple and Google built -- here's why

summary: As some of the largest wildfires ever rage in California, firefighting tactics remain stagnant. Innovation needs a boost to catch up with the rate at which the west is burning.
headline: How the U.S. battles forest fires and why more innovation is desperately needed

summary: For many Americans, retiring early may mean giving up their employer-subsidized health insurance. Here are a few options for coverage that won't break the bank.
headline: Here's how much health insurance costs if you retire early
The White House hoped testing would keep the coronavirus out — but it didn't
summary: "I don't think any experts recommend that you use medical screening tests as a replacement for social distancing, or masks, or other kinds of mitigation efforts," Dr. Ben Mazer, an anatomic and clinical pathologist at Johns Hopkins Hospital, said.

Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai and Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey will testify on Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act. The hearing will also cover the topics of privacy and "media domination."
headline: Facebook, Google and Twitter CEOs to testify before Congress on Oct. 28

summary: "No Time to Die," the James Bond film that was the first Hollywood feature to move on the theatrical caledar due to the coronavirus outbreak, is moving again. This time, it's got its sights on 2021.
headline: 'No Time to Die' pushed to April 2021 as coronavirus cases continue to rise

summary: Stocks clawed back on Friday from the steep losses that followed President Donald Trump's coronavirus diagnosis after House Speaker Nancy Pelosi signaled progress in relief negotiations.

headline: White House reveals Trump's coronavirus treatment, says he is 'fatigued but in good spirits'

summary: Onetime high-flyer Lululemon has run into trouble over the past month. Todd Gordon of TradingAnalysis.com sees upside from here.
headline: Lululemon could be about to resume its rally. A trader lays out a way to catch the upside

summary: Facebook argues that the documentary-drama that quickly gained popularity for its critical look of tech platforms "buries the substance in sensationalism."
headline: Facebook rebuts 'The Social Dilemma,' a popular Netflix documentary

summary: Investors had been pushing the markets to new highs since stay-at-home orders in March, led by megacap technology.
headline: Benchmark's Bill Gurley compares today's markets to 1999 dot-com boom

summary: Former President Woodrow Wilson became ill with the 1918 flu when he was in Paris in April of 1919, much like current President Donald Trump's Covid-19 diagnosis in 2020.
headline: Trump isn't the first sitting U.S. president to contract a potentially deadly virus in middle of a pandemic, so did Woodrow Wilson in 1918
